alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gadsden, northern Liberty, Decatur and southeastern Seminole Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from West Bainbridge to near Chattahoochee to 7 miles southeast of Marianna. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Quincy, Havana, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Gretna, Bristol, Attapulgus, Brinson, Rock Bluff, Juniper, Douglas City, Florence, Jamieson, Recovery, Laingkat, Quincy Airport, Lowry and Sawdust. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
